The Agreement is the complete and exclusive statement of the agreement between the parties and supersedes all proposals, oral or written, and all other communications between the parties relating to the subject matter of the Agreement, including the online Yammer Terms of Use Agreement with respect to Customer's and its Authorized Users' use of the Services, which is hereby terminated. Any terms and conditions of any purchase order or other instrument issued by Customer in connection with the Agreement which are in addition to, inconsistent with or different from the terms and conditions of the Agreement, including any confidentiality agreement to the extent it purports to cover any Customer Data or other information provided by Customer or Authorized Users in connection with this MSA, shall be of no force or effect. The Agreement may be modified only by a written instrument duly executed by authorized representatives of the parties. Any waiver by either party of any condition, term or provision of the Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver of any other condition, term or provision. If any provision of the Agreement is held invalid or unenforceable, such provision shall be replaced with an enforceable provision with as similar import as is legally permissible and the remainder of the Agreement shall continue in full force and effect.

15.5 Counterparts. The Agreement may be executed in two or more counterparts, including execution evidenced by Customers clicking on the submit button on Yammers website in connection with the purchase of the Services, in which event Yammers execution will be deemed to occur at the same time, each of which shall be deemed to be an original and each of which together shall constitute a single instrument.

SCHEDULE 1

SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT

During the Term of the MSA, the Yammer Service web interface will be operational and available to Customer at least 99.9% of the time in any calendar month (the Performance Commitment). If Yammer does not meet the Yammer Performance Commitment, and if Customer meets its obligations under this Agreement, Customer will be eligible to receive the Service Credits described below. This Yammer Performance Commitment states Customers sole and exclusive remedy for any failure by Yammer to provide the Service.

1. Definitions. The following definitions shall apply to the Yammer Performance Commitment.

a. Downtime means, for a domain, if there is more than a five percent user error rate. Downtime is measured based on server side error rate.

b. Downtime Period means, for a domain, a period of ten consecutive minutes of Downtime. Intermittent Downtime for a period of less than ten minutes will not be counted towards any Downtime Periods.

c. Monthly Uptime Percentage means total number of minutes in a calendar month minus the number of minutes of Downtime suffered from all Downtime Periods in a calendar month, divided by the total number of minutes in a calendar month.

d. Scheduled Downtime means those times where Yammer notifies Customer of periods of Downtime at least five days prior to the commencement of such Downtime. There will be no more than twelve hours of Scheduled Downtime per calendar year. Scheduled Downtime is not considered Downtime for purposes of this Yammer Performance Commitment, and will not be counted towards any Downtime Periods.

e. Service means the service provided by Yammer to Customer under the applicable Agreement.

f. Service Credit means the following:

Monthly Uptime Percentage Days of Service added to the end of the Service term, at no charge to Customer
< 99.9% - ≥ 99.0% 3
< 99.0% - ≥ 95.0% 7
< 95.0% 15

2. Customer Must Request Service Credit. In order to receive any of the Service Credits described above, Customer must notify Yammer within thirty days from the time Customer becomes eligible to receive a Service Credit. Failure to comply with this requirement will forfeit Customers right to receive a Service Credit.

3. Maximum Service Credit. The aggregate maximum number of Service Credits to be issued by Yammer to Customer for any and all Downtime Periods that occur in a single calendar month shall not exceed fifteen days of Service added to the end of Customers term for the Service. Service Credits may not be exchanged for, or converted to, monetary amounts.

4. Yammer Performance Commitment Exclusions. The Yammer Performance Commitment does not apply to any service(s) that expressly exclude this Yammer Performance Commitment (as stated in the documentation for such services) or any performance issues: (i) caused by factors outside of Yammers reasonable control; or (ii) that resulted from Customers equipment or third party equipment, or both (not within the primary control of Yammer).

item.title: Billing Terms
item.dc:creator: eoh
item.content:encoded:
[tabmenu name="terms menu"]

Billing Terms

A Network Administrator has access to the features available here. Such tools are available for a monthly license fee based on the number of users in that Network per month. If there is one Network Administrator for a Network, such person will be responsible for payment of any fees due for such Network. If there is more than one Network Administrator for a Network, the initial Network Administrator will be the billing party of record (the "Customer") unless otherwise changed. The Customer agrees to pay for all products ordered through the Yammer web site using the payment method indicated, and provides Yammer express authorization to charge said fees to the Customer's payment provider at time of purchase. Fees owed depend on the quantity of Network Users per month. Payment of fees shall not be contingent on any events other than the quantity of Network Users per month, unless otherwise agreed in writing by both parties. Any attorney fees, court costs, or other costs incurred in collection of delinquent undisputed amounts shall be the responsibility of and paid for by Customer. If payment is not current, Yammer may immediately cease to provide any and all services to the customer. The fees paid for monthly Network usage are non-refundable, regardless of whether the Claimed Network is terminated prior to the end of the then-current monthly billing period. Charges will automatically renew using the Customer's current credit card account number unless Customer cancels their Network Administration by email to help@yammer.com three (3) days prior to the renewal date to cancel such subscription. All cancellation requests will be processed within five (5) business days. Once the cancellation is processed, a confirmation email will be sent via the customer's email account on record with Yammer. If Customer has a question about a cancellation, Customer should contact Yammer at help@yammer.com. The Company reserves the right to change its fees or billing methods at any time. The Company will provide timely notice to the affected Customers of any such changes. It is the Customer's responsibility to promptly provide the Company with any contact or billing information changes or updates (including phone number, email address, credit card numbers, etc.). Account updates should be made online via the "My Account" tab within the "Administrator" section, once Customer has logged into www.yammer.com. Yammer does not validate all credit card information required by the Customer's payment provider to secure payment. The Customer must notify Yammer about any billing problems or discrepancies within 90 days after charges first appear on their Account statement. If it is not brought to Yammer's attention within 90 days, Customer agrees to waive their right to dispute such problems or discrepancies.

item.title: Yamming on with Yammer in Suncorp
item.dc:creator: Yammer
item.excerpt:encoded: Tigera September 28, 2010 I thought Yammer was quiet was the response from one of my colleagues when he discovered I was on annual leave this week. In mid-2009, Suncorp began using Yammer to provide staff with a platform to collaborate in an informal and immediate manner. I was one of the early adopters of Yammer in Suncorp and currently ranked the most vocal contributor on the internal forum. Owing to the frequency of my daily yams it is little wonder that my colleagues notice my absence from Yammer when I am on leave. Read more at Tigera.

item.content:encoded:
Web Measures February 22, 2011

Yammer, which was originally founded in 2008, is a site set up with companies and its employees in mind. It was reported in September last year, that the service was being used by more than one million users and 80,000 companies globally. On a daily basis, here at OSM we tend to bring you social media news in relation to job hunting, promotion of company brands, increasing customer databases and so on, along with benefits to the emergency services, banks, pubs and restaurants and so on.

item.dc:creator: Yammer
item.content:encoded:

While popular tools like Facebook and Twitter connect people worldwide and have amazing educational benefits, it is their openness that makes them totally unsuitable for the workplace. Thats where Yammer fits in beautifully. As a corporate social network, the only people that can view your organisations feed are your staff.

Read more at Parallel Divergence.

item.title: Return on Networking
item.dc:creator: Yammer
item.content:encoded:
Knowledge Management January 14, 2011

Yammer has a free version and can be adopted by any organization which wants to have an internal social networking site for its employees. Once a site for an organization is created, employees of an organization can join in using their official email id. What Yammer allows us to do is provide an environment to post what we want to share / ask with our fellow employees and in no time you get different perspectives / answers to your queries etc. Of course what you post is there for everyone to see, search and respond to. Users can also create a room or a group for a discussing specific interest area, etc.

Read more at Knowledge Management.

Quick. What is the most popular social media platform within Fortune 500 companies? When I started working here at ICO Partners, I noticed a challenge Ive seen before in large global companies with multiple offices in different locations: theres no water cooler or kitchen shared by everyone in the company. No place where information is passed on naturally from one person to the other, gradually making its way to each staff member until everyone magically knows.

Read more at ICO Partners.

item.title: It's Social, It's Local, It's Yammer
item.dc:creator: Yammer
item.content:encoded:
Ohio State University: Digital Union October 27, 2010

Quick. What is the most popular social media platform within Fortune 500 companies?

If you said Facebook, youd be wrong. Private enterprise-level social networks are the up-and-coming way for employees to share knowledge, collaborate, and keep projects moving forward. While Facebook and Twitter are sometimes seen as distractions in the workplace, platforms like Yammer, Present.ly, and Sales Forces Chatter add value by limiting the social conversations to coworkers and focusing the power of social networking on solving organizational issues.

Read more at Ohio State University: Digital Union.

item.title: Social networks v collaboration tools
item.dc:creator: Yammer
item.content:encoded:
Capgemini October 10, 2010

It seems that social networks, what they are, what they do, does an enterprise need one, etc are the topic of the moment when I am meeting people. Possibly this is because the cloud message has been heard enough times that it has reached a stage where a CIO has either grasped what it means to them in the next year, or given up! Relatively commonly, its because they have social networks springing up all over their enterprise as at least some of their employees decide to make use of the capabilities. There is a last group and its those who have invested in good quality collaboration tools and dont see why they are not being used, or why social networks are needed as well.

Read more at Capgemini.

Yammer is a microblogging or activity stream application which allows a particular community to communicate in a manner very similar to Twitter. It can be accessed via web browser, desktop client, or smart phone. The main difference between Twitter and Yammer is that Yammer is for internal use within an organisation.

But how could I quickly get everyone involved in the company and have some fun at the same time? Yammer did the trick! One quick question posted on our corporate Yammer network instantly spurred co-worker responses from Atlanta to Chicago to Seattle, Montreal, Toronto and more!

Read more at Softchoice.

item.title: Practical Ways to Design Social Media Into Your Training Programs
item.dc:creator: Yammer
item.content:encoded:
Mindflash August 8, 2011

There is a lot of talk about using social media in training or about social learning in the workplace, but frankly there is not a lot of action. There are many reasons for this inaction, but anyone who has worked in an organization knows there is an incredible amount of inertia keeping things the way they have always been done. Learning experience designers need to break free from the gravitational pull of we have always done it this way and try something new. There is no substitute for experimentation.

Read more at Mindflash.

item.title: The Intersection of Yammer and Innovation
item.dc:creator: Yammer
item.content:encoded:
15inno November 1, 2011

I work for Gijima (Pty) Ltd. a large IT company in Johannesburg South Africa. About a year ago, the company realized for a number of market related reasons that it needed to shake itself down and redefine where it wanted to be in 2025 in order to remain relevant and one of the leaders in the South African and a player in the Global IT market. Thus was borne its client centricity program to move away from being a technology focused company to a client centric company. At that stage we had already deployed Yammer as an internal social media platform to test its capabilities as a business tool with no preconceived ideas as to its benefits, challenges or usefulness.

Read more at 15inno.

item.content:encoded:
Jaws October 26, 2011

While I was a fan of Yammer from the get-go, what with its familiar (Facebook) feel and up to the minute applications - I must admit, we at Just Add Water haven't been as active as we'd like with the tool. Yesterday, in a bid to re-ignite my initial love for Yammer, I went along to a talk hosted by their founder and CEO, David Sacks. A few hours later, I emerged from the Intercontinental Park Lane a full on advocate, though sadly not the owner of the raffled iPad.

item.title: Sharing is Caring: How and Why we Use Yammer
item.dc:creator: Yammer
item.content:encoded:
eDreams Blog October 24, 2011

Tuesday, September 27th, Sam on Yammer: Happy World Tourism Day! Before I saw this pop up in my Gmail I have to admit I had no idea it was World Tourism Day. And now that I do? Well, I could write a blog post about it, run a Facebook Campaign or Tweet it. We are an online travel agency after all, so even if do nothing about this information, its at least good to be in the loop. The fact is that if we didnt use collaborative and sharing technology at eDreams, its unlikely that many people in any of the departments would know about World Tourism Day.

Read more at eDreams Blog.

item.content:encoded:
Teale Shapcott September 28, 2011

I thought Yammer was quiet was the response from one of my colleagues when he discovered I was on annual leave this week. In mid-2009, Suncorp began using Yammer to provide staff with a platform to collaborate in an informal and immediate manner. I was one of the early adopters of Yammer in Suncorp and currently ranked the most vocal contributor on the internal forum. Owing to the frequency of my daily yams it is little wonder that my colleagues notice my absence from Yammer when I am on leave.

Once described as a private internet, intranets contained telephone listings, news items, HR forms and policies, and other business-specific information. Through evolution of technology these documents eventually came to be downloadable but rarely interacted with.

It was as if all of a sudden everyone in the organization decided, collectively and at once, hey, I really like this, and am going to write something and then keep replying to and liking what other people are sharing. Within a few short hours, more than 30% of the org had logged on and shared their thoughts.

item.title: Yammer for internal knowledge sharing
item.dc:creator: Yammer
item.content:encoded:
Lasagna and Chips March 04, 2012

Yammer is booming, especially in the Nederland within Europe. Many companies have started their Yammer groups for rapid internal exchange. If you don't know Yammer: Yammer is kind of Twitter (micro-blogging) service which can be used within organisation, so it is not public like on Twitter. The messages can be slightly longer than on Twitter and it is easier to reply (looks a lot like Facebook). Someone from KLM told me for instance he was looking for someone who could explain their wiki system to him. He put out a message on Yammer and found someone who could sit with him and explain it, the very next day. Without Yammer it would have been difficult to find this person.

Read more at Lasagna and Chips.

So to join the Kineo Yammer group, your email address has to have a Kineo domain. This means the big wide world cant peer into your walls. Not that were hiding anything, of course. You know us.

Fancorps Blog February 23, 2012

Late last year we were introduced to Yammer when they brought their Yam Tour through Dallas at Hotel Zaza. It included a presentation by their president David Sacks, as well as a number of clients walking through case studies of how they use Yammer and what it's done to improve and accelerate communication within their companies.

Read more at Fancorps Blog.

Whether your team spans seven cubicles or seven continents, Yammer connects you to the people and information you need to get work done.

a:3:{i:0;s:119:"Share, announcements, links, files, questions, photos, polls, events, and praise with anyone, anywhere in your company.";i:1;s:135:"Tap into the collective brain of your company. Search for expertise, browse topics or simply post a question and crowd-source answers. ";i:2;s:143:"Get the most relevant content automatically delivered to you in real time with Yammers intelligent feed aggregation, filtering, and search. ";}

a:1:{i:0;s:39:"Yammer as a Solution for Sales Brochure";}

My first experience with this sort of internal social concept was when a former employer of mine adopted Yammer, a sort of internal Twitter, for its sales team. Reps across the country helped each other out, solved problems and offered encouragement. Yammer helped us build a better sales team.

a:2:{i:0;s:196:"With Yammer, we receive rapid deployment of critical knowledge across all of our stores. Our store managers across the United States share best practices on ways to better serve target customers.";i:1;s:24:"Woah! I like this thing!";}
Work better together on team projects in real time, with immediate access to company-wide resources.
Discover the Open and Connected Team Workspace
a:4:{i:0;s:14:"Create a Group";i:1;s:22:"Collaborate on Content";i:2;s:13:"Find Anything";i:3;s:19:"Share Across Groups";}
a:4:{i:0;s:35:"Seriously Simple Content Management";i:1;s:16:"Connect Your CMS";i:2;s:28:"Document Creation Gone Viral";i:3;s:29:"Discover Content that Matters";}

a:4:{i:0;s:169:"Upload files, manage versions and keep them easily organized with just a few clicks. Instant notifications will keep you in the loop about any new versions and comments.";i:1;s:79:"Share files from existing content management systems like SharePoint and Box. ";i:2;s:116:"Documents that take a single employee days to produce can be crowd-sourced and created in minutes with Yammer Pages.";i:3;s:137:"Whether its documents, images, or videos, Ticker displays relevant content in real time as it is being created, shared, and discussed.";}
Collaborate on content without a single email or meeting. Find, create, discuss, approve and publish a document together.
Whether youre in the office, at home or on the road, get on-the-go mobile access to team updates and company conversations as they happen.
a:3:{i:0;s:42:"A Forrester Leader in Mobile Collaboration";i:1;s:18:"A Top 5 iPhone App";i:2;s:25:"A Rich Android Experience";}

a:3:{i:0;s:214:"Yammer was named a leader in enterprise mobile collaboration by Forrester Research Inc., a leading independent research firm, in a new August 2011 report: The Forrester Wave: Mobile Collaboration, Q3 2011.";i:1;s:123:"Apple featured Yammers easy to use iPhone app as one of the top 5 iPhone Apps for business in this years Rewind 2011.";i:2;s:70:"Send messages, post replies and share photos from your Android device.";}
Say goodbye to information silos. Integrate Yammer with all of your existing business applications to surface the right information with the right employee no matter what application theyre using.
a:5:{i:0;s:22:"Discover Business Data";i:1;s:26:"Bring Social to SharePoint";i:2;s:30:"Add Social to any Business App";i:3;s:23:"Social Media Monitoring";i:4;s:18:"A Portable Profile";}

a:5:{i:0;s:129:"See what colleagues are working on within other business applications including Salesforce, SharePoint, Box, Netsuite, and more. ";i:1;s:76:"Make SharePoint more social, mobile, and engaging with a Yammer integration.";i:2;s:100:"Instantly add Yammers social functionality to any business application by embedding Yammer feeds.";i:3;s:108:"Track public discussions about your company by importing Twitter streams and RSS feeds directly into Yammer.";i:4;s:114:"Take your company identity and profile info with you into other business applications via Yammers Login Button.";}
a:5:{i:0;s:17:"User Provisioning";i:1;s:12:"Usage Policy";i:2;s:16:"Logical Firewall";i:3;s:15:"Password Policy";i:4;s:11:"Data Export";}
Administer your network securely and easily in the cloud with enterprise-grade tools.

a:3:{i:0;s:190:"Control network access, sync with existing directories, set password policies, and enable SSO for seamless and secure access to Yammer with minimal IT resources and no infrastructure set-up.";i:1;s:49:"Monitor and export Yammer content for ediscovery.";i:2;s:73:"Customize your network design, e-mail settings, usage policies, and more.";}
a:3:{i:0;s:19:"Manage Your Network";i:1;s:17:"Control Your Data";i:2;s:23:"Customize Your Network ";}
a:3:{i:0;s:19:"20 Second Extranets";i:1;s:31:"Many Worlds, One Yammer Account";i:2;s:13:"(Coming Soon)";}

a:3:{i:0;s:135:"Create a dedicated online workspace in 20 seconds to collaborate with important business contacts like customers, partners and vendors.";i:1;s:231:"Move seamlessly between your internal and external business worlds from a single Yammer account. Multiple networks keep conversations and content between colleagues, customers, partners and vendors separate but easily accessible. ";i:2;s:13:"Coming Soon. ";}
a:5:{i:0;s:16:"Network Switcher";i:1;s:14:"Single Sign-On";i:2;s:14:"Members Module";i:3;s:17:"User Provisioning";i:4;s:16:"Logical Firewall";}
Keep important external business contacts in the loop with Yammer external networks so you can spend less time on email, on the phone or on a plane.
Work Smarter, Move Faster, Outpace the Competition

Extend front-line visibility across your company to achieve organizational alignment and efficiency. Stay instantly up to date with your employees, customers and partners. Drive your business forward faster with Yammer.
a:4:{i:0;s:30:"Lead with Precision and Impact";i:1;s:21:"Engage with Employees";i:2;s:18:"Inspire Innovation";i:3;s:19:"Energize Top Talent";}

a:4:{i:0;s:162:"Instantly share your vision with the entire organization. Align every employee behind a common mission. Set trends, drive company culture and be a better leader. ";i:1;s:134:"See whats happening in real time and interact with all levels of your organization. Identify roadblocks and engage your front-line.";i:2;s:90:"Connect employees in open, interactive workspaces to share great ideas anytime, anywhere. ";i:3;s:134:"Cultivate an all-star team by facilitating discussion and recognizing achievements. Uncover hidden talent and nurture future leaders.";}
Shorten the sales cycle by giving sales reps instant access to relevant resources, contacts and content. Connect your sales team on Yammer to close deals and retain customers.
a:4:{i:0;s:22:"Connect Coast to Coast";i:1;s:24:"Coordinate with Contacts";i:2;s:27:"Stay Connected in the Field";i:3;s:18:"Integrate Your CRM";}

a:4:{i:0;s:174:"Bring sales reps together to compare tactics and share competitive insights. Access your entire organization in seconds to give sales reps what they need, when they need it. ";i:1;s:134:"Communicate with customers and collaborate with partners on separate Yammer networks to build stronger, more productive relationships.";i:2;s:156:"Keep your team constantly connected to coworkers and customers with Yammers mobile applications for iPhone, iPad, Android, Blackberry and Windows Phone. ";i:3;s:124:"Track the progress of accounts, opportunities, leads, and campaigns from Salesforce, Dynamics, Netsuite, and more in Yammer.";}
Engage, Retain and Develop Your Employees
Engage your employees and reduce turnover by transforming your company into a deeply engaged community. Boost morale, performance and productivity by connecting your company on Yammer.
a:4:{i:0;s:17:"Empower Employees";i:1;s:28:"Recognize, Reward and Retain";i:2;s:29:"Improve On-Boarding Processes";i:3;s:35:"Accelerate Learning and Development";}

a:4:{i:0;s:80:"Give everyone a voice, facilitate sharing and cultivate a collaborative culture.";i:1;s:114:"Easily recognize achievements, identify influencers and openly praise employees on a company-wide social network. ";i:2;s:101:"Help new hires ramp up faster by connecting them to relevant people, tools and information on Yammer.";i:3;s:61:"Foster formal and informal peer learning across the company. ";}
a:3:{i:0;s:24:"Complete Projects Faster";i:1;s:21:"Maximize IT Resources";i:2;s:30:"Transform Existing Investments";}

a:3:{i:0;s:91:"Facilitate teamwork, track execution and simplify communication across complex IT projects.";i:1;s:170:"Build an IT knowledge base to eliminate redundancy and archive system expertise. Empower employees to find answers independently with a tool they will voluntarily adopt. ";i:2;s:223:"Increase employee engagement with SharePoint, SAP, Salesforce and other business applications by adding social and mobile capabilities. Enable employees to find content across your entire IT ecosystem with Universal Search.";}
Drive IT Efficiency and On-time Delivery

Easy to set up and painless to administer, Yammer enables secure and instant collaboration throughout your entire company to achieve unparalleled business agility. Streamline tasks and manage implementations within your IT team so you can free up resources.
a:2:{i:0;s:86:"Speak in one voice by aligning internal and external messages across the organization.";i:1;s:11:"Accelerate ";}

Yammer creates instant collaboration and communication throughout your entire company for increased organizational alignment. Increase the speed, clarity and relevance of your corporate communications. Speed up content creation, turnaround time and approval cycles with real-time collaboration.
a:4:{i:0;s:24:"Eliminate Mixed Messages";i:1;s:21:"Create Content Faster";i:2;s:23:"Communicate Effectively";i:3;s:42:"Collaborate with Global Teams and Agencies";}

a:1:{i:0;s:278:"Email lists are impersonal, siloed, and are frequently missing people. Yammer groups have truly changed the way we collaborate around projects and departments, as theyre transparent and membership usually takes care of itself. Deb Medsker, Global VP Knowledge Management"";}
